column4: is it possible to run a 64bit OS in virtualbox under 32bit maverick?
I don't think so.
Right click and select remove?
any idea how to do it from CLI?
chmod -x $(which gnome-panel)
If you knew exactly what you were doing, you wouldn't be here asking questions
sys>prefs>main menu
Find the entry you don't want and uncheck it there
any idea how to do that from terminal?
a thousand kittens die
chown the directory to your user again?
What is the directory you're in? Use 'sudo chown -R $USER /path/to/src/dir/' as your normal user
oh I see now
I am hoping you will ;)
ls -lah reveals all
As you normal user: sudo chown -r $USER $HOME
As you normal user: sudo chown -R $USER $HOME
oh, it's more root owned stuff
As your normal user: sudo chown -R $USER $HOME
General rule of thumb: you should be able to compile anything as user (provided the user owns the src dir) but should use root when installing (to a perfix the user doesnt own, like standard /usr )
